triples.name: Hilbert space
triples.relevance: The fundamental mathematical framework for quantum systems in which Hilbert space fragmentation occurs.

triples.name: Ergodicity
triples.relevance: The paper shows ergodicity breaking as a consequence of Hilbert space fragmentation in dipole-conserving systems.

triples.name: Charge conservation
triples.relevance: One of the key conservation laws (charge/total Sz) that constrains the system dynamics in the studied models.

triples.name: Fracton
triples.relevance: Fracton systems exhibit the characteristic charge and dipole conservation properties that the paper analyzes.

triples.name: Spin model
triples.relevance: The paper investigates one-dimensional spin-1 models as concrete examples of dipole-conserving systems.

triples.name: Thermalisation
triples.relevance: The paper studies the breakdown of thermalization (non-thermal behavior) arising from Hilbert space fragmentation.

triples.name: Autocorrelation
triples.relevance: Infinite temperature auto-correlation measurements are used to demonstrate non-thermal behavior in the minimal model.

triples.name: Quantum random circuits
triples.relevance: Random unitary circuit models with dipole conservation are compared to the spin-1 models for validation.

triples.name: Eigenstate
triples.relevance: The paper examines non-thermal eigenstates appearing throughout the energy spectrum due to Hilbert space fragmentation.
